intro: Lasianthera lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lasianthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential medicinal properties.
